intro: Diplycosia sagittanthera, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and capsules as its fruiting structures. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
